a classical build. It provides us to do multitasking therefore cooling system has also been 
included in these CPU. 2) STORAGE: - 
      Supports up to storage 3xNVMe slots storage due to this it can boot up the speed for 
NVMe slots which is very useful in reading and writing faster also good for OS. 3)RAM (Random Access Memory): - 
       RAM (Random Access Memory) is the form of electric computer memory that can be 
read and changed in any order, typically used to store working data and machine code. It 
has the capacity up to 96 GB also helps in doing multi-tasking without giving problem to the 
processing and quick data transfer between CPU and memory. Classes of Computer: 
MICROCOMPUTER 
It is a type of computer which is used for less multitasking and it is flexible and portable i.e., 
can be carried anywhere. Its CPU is made up of microprocessor.

It is not used for processing 
very large amount quickly. Many micro computers are termed as personal computer as it is 
used for personal benefits. MAINFRAME 
 It is a type of computer which is used for multitasking. It is used for higher end programs to 
run and it is a large device which is not flexible. It can process the information very quickly. It is very scalable, secure and are used advanced visualisation

     Areas of Expansion (Justification):  
1. Mainframe Computing: Quantum Tech helps in serving in the industries of finance and 
health care because it needs a large amount of data processing, increasing revenue. 2.

Networking Services: Enhancing networking capabilities to offer cloud computing and 
secure data transfer solutions can establish Quantum Tech as a key player and generate steady 
revenue. Engineering Feasibility 
 Leveraging existing technology for mainframe services and expanding networking services 
aligns with Quantum Tech's strengths. Revenue Prospects  
Mainframes can yield significant profits from industries needing extensive data processing, 
while networking provides consistent income through long-term contracts. B) 
MODERN OPERATING SYSTEM 
i) 
Device Management: It functionally controls hardware devices like 
printer, keyboard and many others. On QuantumX, it allocates resources to 
prevent conflict and also allows QuantumX to get the most out of its CPU, 
storage, and RAM for efficient start-ups. ii) 
User Interface: UI is the type of visual way to interact with the computer 
example icons, touchscreen etc.

The OS provides user-friendly interface, 
making it easy to execute tasks quickly and boosting productivity. iii) 
Networking: It manages the data transfer and security. The OS comes with 
built-in networking capabilities, enabling easy resource sharing and 
communication. Description of Four Ways an Operating System Works in Harmony with Computer 
Hardware 
i) 
Resources Allocation: The OS distributes the hardware resources among 
program and prioritizes the tasks. The OS optimizes system efficiency by 
distributing hardware resources among applications. ii) 
Error Handling: It is mainly use to detect the hardware faults, The OS detects its 
and recover i.e., it reboots the system and ensure the stability. iii) 
I/O Device Management: It is a input output device for data entry or exit. The 
OS acts as a mediator between applications and I/O devices, facilitating smooth 
data flow. iv) 
Device Drivers: It is a software bridges between OS and specific hardware.

These 
make sure compatibility and prevent improper use of resources by allowing the 
OS to communicate with the hardware. For deeper discussion, OS characteristics like multitasking (running multiple 
apps) or virtualization (simulating extra hardware) enhance QuantumX's high-
performance by leveraging multi-core CPUs for parallel work, minimum costs in 
start-ups. Features of security such as fire walls integrate with hardware 
encryption for extra data protection, this relationship increases hardware potential, 
turning QuantumX into a useful, versatile, profitable tool for tech ecosystems. Relationship with Hardware Performance Optimization:  
a)  Performance Optimization: The OS boosts hardware performance by efficiently 
allocating resources. b)  Driver Management: It helps the device manager to ensure a pleasant coordination 
between hardware and software. c)  Error Recovery: The OS deals with hardware malfunctions and recovery, minimizing 
disruptions.

d)  Input/Output Management: It handles data flow between peripherals and 
the CPU, ensuring effective interactions. A)   
a) Application Software: The term application software is referred to all application 
collectively and can be used to differentiate from system and utility software. It is 
a type of software which is used to or allow us to perform a specific task. Out of 
this the most popular is the Microsoft word, which is a program that process the 
word and also allow us/users to create, edit and format the text documents. Among other things, application software is often equipped with options for the 
end user to retain business, educational, and personal items. b) System Software: The system software is designed to provide a platform of other 
software. This type of software manages the fundamental functions of a 
computer's hardware, acting as an intermediary between the hardware and the 
user.

It deals with both hardware and software therefore it is a platform for 
application software. One example of this is Microsoft Windows that does 
management of the areas of the hard drive, memory, and input/output (I/O) 
devices making sure that the system is functioning properly. It serves as the 
essential link connecting a computer's hardware to all application software and 
the end user for smooth operation. c) Development Software: Development software encompasses the tools and 
processes involved in designing, coding, testing, and maintaining computer 
programs and applications. It is mostly used for developing the software. The best 
example of this is Visual Studio, an application programming interface called a 
(IDE) that is used by programmers to code, trial and resolve code. Such a program 
is a must-have for developers who want the software to operate properly, and the 
tools are the platform on which they work. They get rid of window effects and 
open a brand-new window.

• 4 MAIN TYPE OF APPLICATION SOFTWARE 
 
i) 
Productivity Software: It is also called personal productivity software or office 
productivity software is an application of software used for producing 
information. As the name says productivity its work is use to allow the user to 
perform the task very smoothly and proficiently. The most used example is 
Microsoft word (MS word), Spreadsheet and Presentation tools (POWER 
POINT). Productivity software increases the productivity in professional, 
educational, and personal contexts by ensuring rapid content creation and 
transfer. It is all just about creating, managing, and organizing information. ii) 
Multimedia Software: Multimedia software is a type of device which can 
allow users to make, edit, and manipulate different types of media content like 
pictures, audio, and visuals. It is type of medium that allows the information to 
transfer from one place to another.

There are 2 categories in multimedia i.e., 

linear multimedia and non-linear multimedia. The apps are for image editing, 
including Adobe Photoshop, audio editing, i.e., Audacity, and video editing, 
such as Adobe Premiere Pro. These tools have opened great vistas in the art and 
music curriculum, and students are able to design their own music videos, 
animations, and 3D modelling. iii) 
Communication Software: It is a type of software that allows the users to 
exchange the information in different types such as audio-visual video, files etc. It also supports real-time interaction, and sometimes efficient workflow 
management, managing gaps between scattered teams and departments. They 
are mostly used for education purpose for tasks like video conference, online 
lectures, or content sharing. The most common examples of google are Zoom, 
google meet and skype.

iv) 
Entertainment Software: Entertainment software is software created for 
enjoyment and entertainment purpose, such as online games like BGMI, FIFA, 
Minecraft, media players like VLC, and hot streaming platforms like Netflix. It 
encompasses a broad range of applications that engage users through interactive 
experiences, multimedia content, and creative expression. The most prominent 
type of entertainment software is video games. How Software is Executed by the CPU and Interfaces with System 
Components: 
 Implementing application operation with the customer launching an application is the type of 
way that the software comes to life. The operating system (OS) regulates this through the 
process of loading the application's code into the computer's memory (RAM). The CPU take 
over the memory space when then the software is loaded into the memory. a) Instruction fetching: The CPU takes the instructions from the application's code stored 
in RAM, only one at a time.

b) Instruction Decoding: The CPU decodes each and every instruction to determine the 
correct action, changing the commands into a format it can get execute. c) Execution: Maths and logic units of command is carried by the CPU, performing 
operations like data shifts, or communicating with other components. Interfacing with Other Components:  
a) Memory (RAM): The Central Processing Unit continuously reads and writes data in 
RAM during the execution of the software. b) Storage Devices: If the data is not required in Random access memory (RAM), then 
CPU requests it from storage devices (like SSDs or HDDs) through the OS. c)  I/O Devices: Software often interacts with input/output devices like keyboards, 
mouse, printers using device drivers, which increases communication between the 
software and the devices. d) Output Generation: Results are either placed back in RAM by the CPU or sent 
directly to an output device.

B) 
• Compiler: It is a type of software that helps to translate from one programming 
language to another programming language. The name Compiler is primarily used 
for programs that translate source code from a high-level programming language to 
a low-level programming language to create an executable program. Since the 
QantumTech is designed for high performance compiler helps delivering fast and 
optimized software that is able to take full advantage of system processing power. • Interpreter:  It is a type of software that execute the source code first without 
compiling it into machine code. Its language is different from compiling language, 
which involves the translation of source code into CPU-native executable code. Compiler reads the code line by line rather than converting the whole program at 
once. Examples are Python or JavaScript.

This is very helpful in the initial 
development phases or for scripting within larger software suites, streaming the 
process for QuantumTech’s development teams. • Integrated Development Environment (IDE): This is a software that unites 
different types of programming tools into one interface. Most popular examples of 
this are Visual Studio and Eclipse. It is a central workstation for programmers. Some IDEs are only for a specific programming language, allowing a feature set 
that most precisely matches the programming paradigms of the language. Even 
though, there are many different language IDEs. • Version Control System: It is a software that traces and manage the changes to 
files and projects all over time, allowing users to recall specific previous versions, 
differentiate changes, revert to earlier states, and collaborate on projects. The 
common examples of this are Git.

For a device like QuantumTech, a VCS is 
critical to managing group-oriented software projects, supporting ongoing 
maintenance, and scaling development as the business increases. A) 
1. LAN (Local Area Network): The main purpose of LAN is to connect all devices 
within the area such as campus, home or office. It connects the computer, printer and 
the servers. Its key purpose is to share the resources, share the internet and 
security.LAN mainly works by connecting the devices ton the computer and the 
printers within a small and cornified are using Ethernet cable or by using the Wi-Fi 
managed by the devices like switches and the routers. The main difference of LAN 
between the them is it covers the small area such as home, office or campus. It is 
faster and private. The speed of this network is comparatively higher that the other 
two that is WAN and MAN.

LAN uses private network addresses for network 
connectivity for data and service exchange, and it uses cable for network connection, 
decreasing error and maintaining data security. 2. WAN (Wide Area Network): The main purpose of WAN is to connect all LANs 
throughout the city and expands the network and allowing the users to share the 
information through a very large range. WAN mainly works by connecting multiple 
Local Area Networks (LANs) and other networks through a large geographical 

distance. The main difference of WAN between them is it covers the city and it 
slower and complex manageable. Its speed of network is less than LAN and also than 
MAN also. It uses the satellite medium to transfer the data between multiple location 
and network towers. Its main disadvantage is that its cost is very high compare to 
another network. 3.

MAN (Metropolitan Area Network): The main purpose of MAN is to provide high 
speed data communication and resource sharing across a large geographical area. The 
work of a MAN is a computer network that covers a large geographic area, like a city, 
connecting multiple local area networks (LANs) together. The main difference 
between MAN and the others are it covers a very wide network it can be extended up 
to continents also its coverage is not very high or very low(moderate). Its main 
disadvantage is that it has a high probability of getting attacked by the hacker and 
anybody can steal information of other people who is connected to the same network. This has advantage that its network coverage area is very high and can be covered to 
the whole city that is why it is very useful.

TOPOLOGY 
 
 
   
 
 
STAR TOPOLOGY 
 A star topology is a network setup where all peripheral devices (like computers and 
printers) are connected to a central hub or switch, creating a star shape with the hub at 
the centre. It is the most useful topology as it is easy to be implemented. • Structure: Its all device is connected to the central hub or a switch. • Scalability: Very easy to add devices with the help of switches and the routers. • Needed items: Switches, routers, Ethernet cables and Network Interface card. • Reliability: If a single connection fails it does not affect the other devices which are 
connected. B)   
Star Topology 
A star topology is a network setup where all peripheral devices (like computers and printers) 
are connected to a central hub or switch, creating a star shape with the hub at the centre. It is 
the most useful topology as it is easy to be implemented. • Structure: It’s all device is connected to the central hub or a switch.

• Scalability: Very easy to add devices with the help of switches and the routers. • Needed items: Switches, routers, Ethernet cables and Network Interface card. • Reliability: If a single connection fails it does not affect the other devices which are 
connected. Tree Topology 
A tree topology is a topology in which the network is arranged in a hierarchical order or in a 
tree like structure featuring a central root node and multiple branches and sub-branches 
connecting devices in levels. It is comparatively less useful than star topology as it more 
complex than star topology to be implemented also it has a very low reliability also. •  Structure: It is in hierarchical order and has a backbone cable. •  Scalability: It is very useful in and scalable for large network, most common in 
universities and corporation. • Needed Items: Switches, backbone cabling and routers for larger segmentation. • Reliability: If the backbone fails then it will affect the whole network.

Mesh Topology 
A mesh topology is a topology in which all the network is interconnected directly with 
multiple other devices, creating several alternative paths for data transmission. • Structure: All the devices are connected to each other either by fully or by partially. • Scalability: Due to very high cabling and setup cost it is very difficult to scale. • Needed Items: Switches, Router, Multiple NICs and extensive cabling. • Reliability: If one links fails then the data can be rerouted that’s why it is extremely 
reliable. Hybrid Topology 
A hybrid topology Is a topology in which that combines two or more different basic network 
topologies, such as star, tree or mesh, to leverage the advantages and minimize the 
disadvantages of each individual topology. It has the least use compared to another topology 
as these topologies is very complex and vey hard to implement. It also needs 2 topologies to 
get implemented.

• Structure: In this the structure is a combination of two topology (for example mesh 
and star). • Scalability: Its is flexible and depending on their structure it is scalable. • Needed Items: Switches, router, hubs and cables. • Reliability: It varies and combines reliability of selected topologies. C)   
Layer 1- Physical Layer: Physical layer deals with the hardware transmission such 
as cables, switches and signals 
 
Layer 2- Data Link Layer: Data Link layer ensures that there is none error transfer 
between two nodes which are interconnected directly. Layer 3-Network Layer: Networks are being packed by the routes. Routers use this 
for inter-network navigation. Layer 4-Transport: Transport ensures end to end delivery using error checking and 
retransmission. Layer 5-Session Layer: It manages connection and communication session. Layer 6-Presentation: It translates data formats, ensures format compatibility, 
encryption and compression.

Layer 7- Application layer: It is the uppermost layer and also the closest layer to the 
user and provide service like email and network browsing. By following the OSI model, QuantumX ensures its operating system can 
communicate proficiently with any device using traditional protocols, enhancing 
Compatibility across diverse network types. A)   
Why there is opportunity to consider distributed computing services as an extension to the 
new networking services? The opportunity to consider distributed computing service as an extension to the new 
networking services because these modern networks are no longer simple conduit for the 
data. The synergy allows for powerful new applications by strategically placing compute 
resources where they can be most effective, resulting in lower latency, better performance, 
and increased efficiency. The driven keys for this convergence are increasing demands for 
low latency, Increasing of Internet of Things, Advance security requirement and many more.

Distributing Computers 
It is a type of model in which software system components are being spread across various 
computer, or nodes through network. Distributed computing is the field of computer science 
that studies distributed systems known as computer systems whose interconnected 
components are located on different networked computers. The components of a distributed 
system communicate and coordinate their action by passing message to one another in order 
to achieve a common goal. Client Server model 
The architecture of this model is centralised as the one or more central servers provide 
resources. The roles of this are Asymmetrical as it does not follow any symmetry. The data 
are stored in centralized servers. QuantumTech's initial proposal is a classic client-server 
model, where their high-performance server would serve as the central resource for the start-
ups (clients).

Peer-to-Peer Model 
The architecture of this model is decentralised as all the nodes are essentially equal. The roles 
are Symmetrical as it follows the symmetry. The data is distributed to the individual peers. Distributed computing, specifically using a P2P or hybrid architecture as an extension, would 
allow the start-ups to harness a shared network of resources more dynamically and resiliently 
than a single server can provide. 4 characteristics of Distribution Computer. • Concurrency: Concurrency in the distributed Computer is known as multiple process 
or transaction are being accessed and are modifies shared data across different location 
simultaneously. In the start ups there is a big project to be run it make 
difficult/complex to perform some of these massive project or tasks by this 
concurrency make the tasks simple by making in into smaller chunks that are 
processed parallel by multiple QuantumTech-provided computer nodes.

• Scalability: Scalability in distributed computing is the system do work to handle 
increasing workloads, data, or user demand by increasing resources, improvising 
existing resources, and proficiently distributing tasks through methods like data 
seperation. With a distributed model, QuantumTech can simply add more high-
powered QuantumX-based nodes to the network on demand. This ensures the client's 
service remains consistent during peak loads without requiring them to purchase 
excess hardware they only use occasionally. • Fault Tolerance: In this type if even one machine fails to work the current workload 
can be transferred to different machine. This is very critical for start-ups to avoid 
downtime and maintain service even if hardware does not function. Reliability is quite 
critical, especially for operations like cryptography.

If even one of QuantumTech’s 
nodes does not function due to some internal error, the business-critical computation is 
directly re-routed or gets continued by other nodes, ensuring service continuity and 
preventing the loss time to correct this error. • Transparency: Transparency in the distribution computer hides the system’s inherent 
complexity, making the users to allow only single and centralized system rather than a 
collection of geographically dispersed components. It makes and ensure that and 
focusses only on running and writing the names only on a strong computer. This 
significantly simplifies developing, deployment, and management, allowing them to 
focus on innovation for the start-ups’. B) 
Quantum Computing. Quantum computing is an emergent field of computer science and engineering that harnesses 
the unique qualities of quantum mechanics to solve problems beyond the ability of even the 
most powerful classical computers.

It is still in the development but later the quantum 
computer an even solve the question or tasks that not even the supercomputer can even solve. Advantages of Quantum Computing. • Speed: Speed of the Quantum Computer is very higher than other types of computers. It solves the problems and tasks in a quicker manner than any other computers. It can 
analyse the data in a very short time. • Parallel Computing: It is type of phenomenon which follows the principle of 
superposition which can perform calculation on multiple possible inputs 
simultaneously within a single quantum circuit, exploring many computational paths 
at once. • Optimisation: Quantum computing is especially powerful in optimization problems, 
where many potential solutions need to be evaluated to find the best one. Therefore, 
machine learning start-ups can enjoy the faster finding of perfect solutions which 
bring about savings in time and resources. Why is Quantum Computer suitable for Cryptography?

It is suitable because it is assumed that it can breakdown the traditional encryption method 
which is much faster than the Shor’s algorithm. On the other hand, it provides more security 
and also quantum safe encryption methods. For QuantumTech and its clients in Techville, 
this means both stronger security capabilities and preparing in the future ahead where 
quantum-based cryptography standards become the standard. For QuantumTech, providing 
quantum solutions will be a beneficial advantage to new cryptographic startups. The feature 
of quantum computing to add security is that it gets in sync with the surge in the demand for 
secure communication and data protection across industries like banking, medicine, and 
government.
